name: Sociology of Race and Ethnicity
description: This lecture course offers a theoretical and methodological discussion that will teach students to think sociologically about race and ethnicity. We will examine why the link between race and biology is problematic and the scientific evidence for it; how can we think about race and ethnicity without assuming that people are naturally divided into groups; social processes of ethnic and racial classification and ethnic and racial boundaries; ethnic and racial inequality, and how it is reproduced and contested. [24L]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/SOC231H5, SOC221H5, SOC222H5, 1.0 SOC credit at the 300 level
